uk.ac.qmul.sbcs.evolution.convergence.util.stats
Class ProbabilityDensityFunction

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.qmul.sbcs.evolution.convergence.util.stats.ProbabilityDensityFunction

public class ProbabilityDensityFunction
extends java.lang.Object

Since:
r145 2013/04/07

A class to allow for a KolmogorovTest, which requires an EmpriricalDistribution

This represents unsorted real-valued input data as a probability density function.

Version:
0.1
Author:
Joe Parker, Kitson Consulting / Queen Mary University of London
See Also:
EmpiricalDistribution, KolmogorovTest

rebinOnNewInterval

public void rebinOnNewInterval(java.math.BigDecimal[] newBinLimits)
A void method to re-bin the existing function onto new limits.

The intention is that this will ensure two sets of data can produce EmpiricalDistributions with equivalent bins, so that they can be directly compared in a jsc.goodnessfit.KolmolgorovTest, as if they were a unit distribution (bounded on [0:1]).

In usage the call for this would probably go something like: 

        (Given two distributions a and b)
        ProbabilityDensityFuncition A = new ProbabilityDensityFuncition(a)
        ProbabilityDensityFuncition B = new ProbabilityDensityFuncition(b)
  BigDecimal[] jointRange
  jointRange[0] = min(A,B)
  jointRange[1] = max(A,B)
  EmpiricalDistribution ed_A = new EmpiricalDistribution(A.rebinOnNewInterval(jointRange).getFunction())
  EmpiricalDistribution ed_B = new EmpiricalDistribution(B.rebinOnNewInterval(jointRange).getFunction())
  KS.test(ed_A, ed_B)
Though of course actually the main PDF constructor could just be called with specified limits.. that ought to work, will need to inspect the test harness to work out why it's not.
Ah yes, because the ED is still making reference to the bin limits so it only gets the density over [0:1]?
Etc. see also:

Parameters:
newBinLimits - - the new bin limits.
See Also:
EmpiricalDistribution, jsc.goodnessfit.KolmolgorovTest
